MarkdownBlockBase.ItemValue:
<properties pageTitle="179e58c4-2505-446b-976e-3563bcaa6a78" description="d8cd0d89-8cd9-4f57-8b7b-97054979733a" services="machine-learning" documentationCenter="" authors="jaymathe" manager="paulettm" editor="cgronlun"/>
<tags ms.service="machine-learning" ms.workload="data-services" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="09/02/2015" ms.author="jaymathe"/>

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: # Add in the CSV file with the data in the format shown below

# data input data <- maml.mapInputPort(1) # class: data.frame library(forecast)
# preprocessing colnames(data) <- c("frequency", "horizon", "dates", "values") dates <- strsplit(data$dates, ";")[[1]] values <- strsplit(data$values, ";")[[1]]
dates <- as.Date(dates, format = '%m/%d/%Y') values <- as.numeric(values)
# fit a time-series model train_ts<- ts(values, frequency=data$frequency) fit1 <- auto.arima(train_ts) train_model <- forecast(fit1, h = data$horizon) plot(train_model)
# produce forecasting train_pred <- round(train_model$mean,2) data.forecast <- as.data.frame(t(train_pred)) colnames(data.forecast) <- paste("Forecast", 1:data$horizon, sep="")
# data output maml.mapOutputPort("data.forecast");
